name: Sao Paulo
hint: Largest city in South America and Brazil's financial hub

name: Buenos Aires
hint: Capital of Argentina, known as the Paris of South America

name: Lima
hint: Capital of Peru, located on the Pacific coast in a desert

name: Bogota
hint: Capital of Colombia, one of the highest capital cities in the world

name: Santiago
hint: Capital of Chile, nestled in a valley between the Andes and the coast

name: Caracas
hint: Capital of Venezuela, located in a mountain valley near the Caribbean coast

name: Quito
hint: Capital of Ecuador, situated almost exactly on the equator at high altitude

name: Montevideo
hint: Capital of Uruguay, on the northern shore of the Rio de la Plata

name: La Paz
hint: Administrative capital of Bolivia, highest capital city in the world

name: Brasilia
hint: Purpose-built capital of Brazil, designed in the shape of an airplane

name: Medellin
hint: Second-largest city in Colombia, known as the City of Eternal Spring

name: Rio de Janeiro
hint: Brazilian city famous for Christ the Redeemer statue and Copacabana Beach

name: Guayaquil
hint: Ecuador's largest city, a major Pacific port and gateway to the Galapagos Islands

name: Cali
hint: Colombia's third-largest city, known as the world capital of salsa dancing

name: Cordoba
hint: Argentina's second-largest city, a university town at the foothills of the Sierras

name: Recife
hint: Major coastal city in northeastern Brazil, called the Venice of Brazil for its waterways

name: Salvador
hint: Historic city in northeastern Brazil, the first capital of colonial Brazil

name: Fortaleza
hint: Coastal city in northeastern Brazil, known for beautiful beaches and seafood

name: Belo Horizonte
hint: Brazil's third-largest metro area, a planned city surrounded by mountains in Minas Gerais

name: Asuncion
hint: Capital of Paraguay, one of the oldest cities in South America on the Paraguay River

name: Sucre
hint: Constitutional capital of Bolivia, known as the White City for its colonial buildings

name: Cusco
hint: Former capital of the Inca Empire in Peru, gateway to Machu Picchu

name: Cartagena
hint: Walled colonial city on Colombia's Caribbean coast, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: Barranquilla
hint: Colombia's fourth-largest city, famous for its Carnival second only to Rio's

name: Maracaibo
hint: Second-largest city in Venezuela, on the shores of oil-rich Lake Maracaibo

name: Manaus
hint: Largest city in the Amazon, where the dark Rio Negro meets the sandy Amazon River

name: Porto Alegre
hint: Capital of Brazil's southernmost state, gateway to gaucho culture and European heritage

name: Curitiba
hint: Brazilian city famous for its innovative urban planning and bus rapid transit system

name: Valparaiso
hint: Colorful Chilean port city built on steep hillsides, a UNESCO World Heritage Site

name: Concepcion
hint: Chile's second-largest metro area, a university city near the Pacific coast

name: Georgetown
hint: Capital of Guyana, the only English-speaking country in South America

name: Paramaribo
hint: Capital of Suriname, a UNESCO-listed city with Dutch colonial architecture on the Suriname River

name: Mendoza
hint: Argentine city at the base of the Andes, capital of the country's wine country

name: Santa Cruz de la Sierra
hint: Bolivia's largest city and economic powerhouse, in the tropical lowlands

name: Arequipa
hint: Peru's White City built from volcanic sillar stone, near the Colca Canyon

name: Rosario
hint: Argentina's third-largest city on the Parana River, birthplace of Che Guevara and Messi

name: Belem
hint: Brazilian city at the mouth of the Amazon, gateway to the river and its rainforest

name: Iquitos
hint: Largest city in the world unreachable by road, deep in the Peruvian Amazon

name: Punta Arenas
hint: Southernmost major city in Chile, on the Strait of Magellan facing Tierra del Fuego

name: Ushuaia
hint: World's southernmost city in Argentina, known as the End of the World

name: Cayenne
hint: Capital of French Guiana, near Europe's spaceport at Kourou

name: Trujillo
hint: Peru's third-largest city, near ancient Moche and Chimu archaeological sites

name: Mar del Plata
hint: Argentina's most popular beach resort city on the Atlantic coast

name: Florianopolis
hint: Island capital of Santa Catarina in Brazil, famous for its 42 beaches

name: Potosi
hint: Historic Bolivian silver mining city, once the richest in the Americas at 4000m altitude

name: Bariloche
hint: Argentine Patagonian city known for skiing, chocolate, and a stunning lake district

name: Natal
hint: Northeastern Brazilian city on the closest point of the Americas to Africa

name: Valencia
hint: Venezuela's third-largest city and industrial center in the Carabobo state

name: Maceio
hint: Capital of Alagoas in northeastern Brazil with crystal-clear turquoise beaches

name: Campinas
hint: Major Brazilian tech and university hub in Sao Paulo state, Silicon Valley of Brazil
